page.title: 08Hubberdale Farm - Flagg
page.content: In the mine's heyday,the older farmhouse(now farm buildings) was partly a public house with a dance floor in one of the upper rooms. Another farm building was the smithy for the mine.Mr.Howe and his partner milk Friesian cows and run a flock of Suffolk sheep. Mr.Howe says that the Suffolks unlike the Oxfords which he used to keep give little trouble in lambing and the ewes are good mothers. The crop nowadays is grass grown for hay and silage though until a few years ago potatoes were grown for retail sales.During the war Mr.Howe grew swedes,cow cabbages and oats for stock feeding.He stacked the sheaves of oats in barns and banged the seeds out against a large piece of stone instead of threshing!
